      • clipPolygon

        public int clipPolygon(int in,
                       float[] inxs,
                       float[] inys,
                       float[] outxs,
                       float[] outys,
                       float llx,
                       float lly,
                       float urx,
                       float ury)
        clipPolygon

        Clip the polygon with vertex count in and vertices inx/iny against the rectangular clipping region specified by lower-left corner (llx,lly) and upper-right corner (urx,ury). The resulting vertices are placed in outx/outy.

        The routine should return the the vertex count of the polygon resulting from the clipping.

        Parameters:
        in - the number of vertices in the polygon to be clipped
        inxs - - x coords of vertices of polygon to be clipped.
        inys - - y coords of vertices of polygon to be clipped.
        outxs - - x coords of vertices of polygon resulting after clipping.
        outys - - y coords of vertices of polygon resulting after clipping.
        llx - - x coord of lower left of clipping rectangle.
        lly - - y coord of lower left of clipping rectangle.
        urx - - x coord of upper right of clipping rectangle.
        ury - - y coord of upper right of clipping rectangle.
        Returns:
        number of vertices in the polygon resulting after clipping
